Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; cream slip; interior glazed black with traces of dot and billet pattern in added white; exterior, from top: row of large dots at rim; stopt maeander pband between pairs of bands; reserved area painted inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as Berlin V.I.3150,3. Lamb incorrectly identifies the sherd as coming from a chalice.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 165, no. 22)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 737, no. 967)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 33, no. 21, pl. XVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2016) (phase 2)
